genuine.translation[0].definitions[0].de: a genuine feeling, desire etc is one that you really feel, not one you pretend to feel
genuine.translation[0].definitions[0].ex: ‘Did he really?’ Her surprise seemed genuine.
The reforms are motivated by a genuine concern for the disabled.
genuine.translation[0].definitions[1].de: something genuine really is what it seems to be
genuine.translation[0].definitions[1].ex: We need laws that will protect genuine refugees.
genuine.translation[0].definitions[2].de: someone who is genuine is honest and friendly and you feel you can trust them
genuine.translation[0].definitions[2].ex: She is the most genuine person I’ve ever met.
genuine.translation[0].note_box[0].secti: genuine
used about a feeling, thing, or person that really is what they seem to be
genuine concern
Experts believe that the painting is genuine.
genuine refugees
a genuine reason for taking time off work
If a student has genuine religious objections to a school activity, they do not have to participate.
not false or artificial
real wood
His real name is Reginald.
It looks just like the real thing.
Are those flowers real or artificial?
authentic
authentic  food, music, clothes etc are correct for the place or the period in history that they are supposed to be from
It’s a friendly restaurant offering authentic Greek food.
authentic medieval instruments
The dancers wore authentic Native American designs.
true
having all the qualities you would expect a particular type of person or thing to have
a true friend
She is a true professional.
Being a true Red Sox fan, he never missed a game.
True Christians believe that Jesus is the Son of God.
bona fide
bona fide people or things are really what they say they are, especially when this can be checked by looking at official documents
a bona fide medical qualification
a bona fide company
This club is only open to bona fide members.
hard evidence/facts
evidence or facts that are genuine and can be proved
There was no hard evidence to support the theory.
